titles.title: Family Investment Retirement Savings Tax (FIRST) Credit Act of 1999
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow certain individuals a credit against income tax for elective deferrals and IRA contributions.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 7/19/1999--Introduced. Family Investment Retirement Savings Tax (FIRST) Credit Act of 1999 - Amends the Internal Revenue Act to allow an individual an annual credit ($1,000 maximum) for 50 percent of his or her deductible IRA contribution and the amount of specified retirement plan employer contributions not included in the individual's gross income. Limits such credit based upon adjusted gross income. Provides a five-year increased penalty period, with specified exceptions, for early distributions from such plans and increases the penalty tax to 60 percent (currently, ten percent).
